titleInfo.title: Information for Action: An Advocate's Guide to Using Maternal and Child Health Data

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report is based largely on the experience of a project in San Francisco, CA, between 1987 and 1990. A joint university and health dept. effort improved the capacity of the San Francisco Dept. of Public Health (SFDPH) to monitor key information related to maternal and child health, especially for vulnerable groups. The project produced several reports on the status of perinatal health and children's health and well-being in San Francisco. Thise reports demonstrated the potential of information to help community advocacy groups, service providers, and program planners identify priorities for policy decisions and resource allocation.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)
